comments.commentBody: Boy did I have a lousy marriage. Congratulations AKR on sending your love for your husband 'round the world forever and ever. What a wonderful tribute to him... and to you. I am so sorry you will not grow very, very old together with your wonderful Jason.

Dearest Amy,

I'm not an emotional person, nor one drawn to heartache, but your article brought me to tears. It is fresh and full of love. Your description of your husband has given me a drive to be a better man, a man deserving of the admiration and obvious respect you have for Jason. I wish with all my heart I could meet you or just speak with you for a moment, to see the intricate detail of a life well lived hidden within your tired eyes.

Sleep well Amy, rest in the knowledge you have brought earthly bliss to at least one other soul.

Love,
David

Other than writing, other ways to do this include recording your voice or a video of yourself. Or have someone help you.

Many years ago, as part of a sociology class assignment, we were required to interview someone elderly. I chose a professor who was highly respected in my field as well as others and was just known as a great all around person. Our conversation was all professional and I recorded it with a tape recorder. (this was the 1990s) As a last minute thought, I made an extra copy of my written-up assignment and the tape for her and sent it through the mail. I received a lovely letter back detailing how glad she was to participate in my assignment and how she had not anticipated how valuable it was to have something like our conversation to leave to her children/ grandchildren (she was in her 90s so it's not the exact situation as if she has passed away young but still). So yes, if you can, leave something for your children.

Amy,
In quiet moments my mother would say that people who were born with a talent were obligated to share it with others. Thank you for sharing this gift. Thank you for teaching us ablout Plan Be. Finally,thank your family for sharing you with all of us.

Any Russian investments would be hidden under layers of Cayman Island companies. Debt is more likely and lenders are not revealed on tax returns. It would be better if one or two IRS Trump auditors retire and start leaking knowledge not tax forms. Trump is trying to hide that he is a billionaire who pays less tax than his janitors.

Thank you for this generous gift of intimacy to us imperfect strangers.  We know you and Jason a little now.  We are grateful to you for writing this love letter to us all when you are in such pain. I don't think you need to worry about Jason.  Your love provisions him for a very long journey, whether it is with another person or whether it just continues with you.  Perhaps Jason has so much because you have given him so much, and he has been smart enough to save it.  There may not be a way to give you more time with him and your children, but they will walk with you each and every day for the rest of their lives, and your life and love with sustain them and help them as they continue their walk.  You are not alone, and they are not alone.  You can lay your burdens down, and be completely assured that you have already given them way more than they need.

It is so sad to read of such love about to end. We want so much for those we love and protect, but in the end, we can't create magic.
I used to think that my extraordinary husband should never be alone, and if I died first, I would want him to find someone who would be amazing company, have passionate discussions, but that's not what happened. He's gone, and I know there will never be anyone else. We can hope for happiness for those we love, but in the end, if we are left, we loved them, and for many, it's nearly impossible to move on. What we have are memories of happiness, sadness, arguments, making up, all the milestones we passed together, children, and love. Then, suddenly, everything stops, and you're left with unbelievable loss. You put one foot in front of the other, you keep going, but it will never ever be the same.

Richard, get over it. This is all Sessions doing, nobody else. He could have simply responded  yes he had contact with the Russians and this would have been but a footnote if that in history. He chose to lie. I'm no lawyer Richard but from my dealings with US attorneys one thing I do recall them advising me of is that when a question is asked of you to give the  honest direct answer and nothing else. Ol' Jeff should have heeded this advice, instead he decided to improvise, kinda like Mr. Orange does on occasion and like it often does with Mr. Orange it went south in a hurry. You're pretty savvy but for some reason you seem to missing the point here. Sessions meetings were possibly very  much innocuous and part of his duties it is the fact that he CHOSE to lie about them occurring that is the issue.

Yes, poor President Bone Spurs will really have no other choice than to stick up for his lying Attorney General by "going after 'enemies' with unsubstantiated innuendo". Like he hasn't done that already, even before Jeff told his whoppers.
But wouldn't that imply an ability to experience shame?
More over, Vegas. What happens in Cleveland, stays in Cleveland.

comments.userLocation: Fair Verona where we lay our scene
comments.commentBody: Eric Holder sure did. Hillary lied to Congress, too. To from the I.R.S. definitely did. I agree with Vanessa.
I'm just a poor boy trying to make it in a rock-n-roll band and I'd be delighted if you pass on those tax savings to me. Thanks bro
Charming? This old racist coot. He lied under oath. He should resign or be forced to resign. Then he should be disbarred and tried for perjury.
It's even more amusing that even though Sessions 'can't remember' much of anything, he is confident that whatever it is he can't remember, he knows it isn't bad.
Gail you can pencil me in strongly in permanent ink to choose C. Both. We have to kill these cockroaches with sunshine. Resist and Replace the whole lot of them.

Sessions of all people, doesn't deserve a second chance.  The highest law enforcement official in the land needs to held to the highest standard in the land. How stupid do you have to be to voluntarily incriminate yourself under oath at your confirmation hearing?  Too stupid to be attorney general.

What an outrage that the American people were exposed to the Podesta emails, the exposure of corruption of the DNC, who by the way were the real riggers of the election (yeah, ironic isn't it?), and the blatant quid pro quo of the Clinton Foundation. Sorry Gail, as a progressive Democrat, this means little in comparison to stench of establishment politics that emanate from the carcass of the Democratic Party. How about a piece on Cory Booker, who helped kill the amendment sponsored by Sanders and supported by Ted Cruz, for God's sakes, to import low cost medicines from Canada? An utterly inexplicable action by a Democrat who is suppose to have the working class's interests in mind. I'm sure Big Pharma, his biggest campaign contributor had nothing to do with THAT vote. Do your job Gail if you really want to help the Democrats get their priorities straight and win elections and stop acting like a cat chasing a laser pointer that Trump is waving around.

It is easy to sling mud, far easier to rip down than build up.

Yes, I saw Chuck Schumer eating donuts with Putin.
Yes, I saw Nancy Pelosi in consultations with Medvedev.
Yes, I read McCaskill Tweet, but then I read her other tweet
and, I believe I saw John Kerry talking with an Iranian

Where are we going with this. If you don't want your lawmakers communication with Russians throw them out of the country, the UN also...out.

However, if you want to prevent conflict, if you want to solve international conflict, if you want a functioning government that interacts with other contrarian regimes, well in that case just shut up and forget this stupidity.
except -- Jeff Sessions LIED under oath!   that we cannot shut up about!

Allison

Everyone of them lied, Hillary was the "gold standard" in lying ( pun intended in reference to her comments about TPP ), so please don't judge one and not the other. Further, Francken question was somewhat ambiguous.

@Blue Moon, you must be talking about Obama who lied about his health care plan, " keep your doctor, keep your plan" not once but 28x in a wide variety of speeches and interviews. The more he repeated the lies the more easily the lies just rolled off his tongue. I could go on and on about Hillary and her lies.... in any event there has been no proof put forth that anyone colluded with the Russians. Just a bunch of Trump haters connecting dots to the outcome they desire.

I can think of many things to do with Sessions, but someone would certainly flag my comments.

Pixie is a great nickname for him! Here are some ways to get rid of pixies:
http://waypastnormal.blogspot.com/2012/04/how-to-protect-yourself-from-f...

After about two months of this charade, the only word that comes to mind is "IMPEACH." I suspect that total honesty is not on either party's kudo's list, but the blatant disregard of any semblance of it as is being shown by Trump and his gang is simply inexcusable. Having to wait even four years is too long.

Sadly, having Trump replaced by the Vice President isn't reassuring either. This is the definition of "stormy weather."

just because Sessions recused himself, that doesnt imply he lied. You have to look closer at questions he was asked.
Please see a heated debate on that at debateIsland.com
http://www.debateisland.com/discussion/503/did-jeff-sessions-lie-about-t...
There are lots of questions asked about Trump-Russia interactions, fueling fire implying they hacked the election. Trump won, Hillary lost. He won on his merit, not because Russia hacked into some voting system
Maybe those remedies should be reviewed and changed while we are at it.  There is far too little accountability on the Hill.
How many of the fine people in the Trump administration will wind up as Edward Snowden's roommates seeking asylum from prosecution?
